citation.article-title: Oceanimonas smirnovii sp. nov., a novel organism isolated from the Black Sea

p.s: Description of O. smirnovii sp. nov.
Oceanimonas (smir’no.vi.i.
NL. gen n. smirnovii, in honour of Ukrainian microbiologist Valery V.
Smirnov).
Cells are 0.8–1.2 μm in diameter and 1.5–2.0 μm long.
Motile, with flagella on both poles.
Aerobic and Gram-negative.
Growth occurs between 10 °C and 45 °C with optimum at 28–30 °C.
No growth is detected at 2 °C and at 50 °C.
The pH for growth ranges from 6.0 to 10.0, with optimum at 7.5–8.5.
Growth occurred at 0–12% of NaCl.
Starch, Tween 80, and gelatin are not hydrolyzed.

Can grow on α-d-glucose, sucrose, d-trehalose, cellobiose, α-d-lactose, maltose, d-ribose, l-rhamnose, l-fructose, glycogen, dextrin, acetate, propionate, malate, malonic acid, itaconic acid, citrate, piruvate, ethanol, fumarate, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, m-hydroxybenzoic acid, betaine, d-alanine, l-alanine, l-glycine, sarcosine, sodium succinate, l-proline, l-glutamate, l-asparagine, l-serine, l-ornithine, l-arginine, l-lysine, l-histidine, l-phenyl-alanine.
Does not utilise d-xylose, l-arabinose, d-arabinose, d-mannose, d-sorbitol, d-galactose, d-raffinose, valeriate, formiate, butyrate, glycerol, adonitol, and m-inositol.
Susceptible to kanamycin, oleandomycin, tetracyclin, neomycin, streptomycin, gentamicin, polymyxin and nonsusceptible to benzylpenicillin, lincomycin, and oleandomycin.
Phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol, and diphosphatidylglycerol are the predominant phospholipids.
The major cellular fatty acids are cis-hexadecenoic, cis-octadecenoic, and hexadecanoic.
Isolated from seawater sample collected in the Karadag Natural Reserve of the Eastern Crimea, the Black Sea.
The G+C content of the DNA 55.6 mol%.
Type strain is 31-13T (=UCM B-11076T=LMG 22147T=ATCC BAA-899T).
